itemDescription: British novelist, spy and former agent

wikipedia_page.main: Noreen Riols (née Baxter, 8 May 1926) is a British novelist. During the Second World War, she worked for the Special Operations Executive, a British espionage and sabotage organisation.

response: The Anglo-French author, Noreen Riols — then a teenager — who had been a student at the French School or Lycée was amongst those sent to Wanborough to provide vital training and vetting.
